intro: Pedicularis garnieri, commonly known as the yellow monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow petals and distinctive spurred structure. The plant is hemiparasitic, meaning it partially relies on host plants for nutrients. It typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and cool climates. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, adding vibrant color to its natural environment.
